definition: to have a fancy (see fancy entry 2 sense 1) for : like
examples: He's all right, I suppose, but I can't say that I fancy him.

definition: to form a conception of : imagine
examples: Just fancy my surprise when I heard that he was getting married.

definition: to believe mistakenly or without evidence
to believe without being certain
examples: she fancied she had met him before

definition: to visualize or interpret as
a liking formed by caprice rather than reason : inclination
examples: took a fancy to the mutt

definition: amorous fondness : love
examples: She took a fancy to the young man.

definition: notion, whim
an image or representation of something formed in the mind
fantastic quality or state
imagination especially of a capricious or delusive sort
examples: His plans to build a new stadium are the product of pure fancy.

definition: the power of conception and representation used in artistic expression (as by a poet)
taste, judgment
devotees of some particular art, practice, or amusement
the object of interest of such a fancy, boxing entry 1
dependent or based on fancy : whimsical
not plain : ornamental, swank sense 2, posh
of particular excellence or highest grade, impressive
bred especially for bizarre or ornamental qualities that lack practical utility
based on conceptions of the fancy
dealing in fancy goods
extravagant
executed with technical skill and style
parti-color
